verbose_text: Evaluating sleep objectively with electroencephalography (EEG), Munch and colleagues [XREF_BIBR] found that exposure to short-wavelength light for two hours starting 3 h before habitual bedtime first lead to decreased slow wave activity (SWA) and thus shallower sleep.
evidence: light for two hours starting 3 h before habitual bedtime first lead to decreased slow wave
